issue.title: Local deletion fails when there is a folder inaccessible by rclone

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
- Ubuntu 16.04 x64
- rclone v1.32
- Dropbox
- Command: `rclone -v sync Dropbox:Folder/ ~/www/Folder/`
- Log (last 5 lines): 

> 2016/08/18 15:29:41 [redacted]: Unchanged skipping
> 2016/08/18 15:29:41 Local file system at /home/user/www/Folder: Waiting for transfers to finish
> 2016/08/18 15:29:41 Local file system at /home/user/www/Folder: not deleting files as there were IO errors
> 2016/08/18 15:29:41 Attempt 3/3 failed with 2 errors and: not deleting files as there were IO errors
> 2016/08/18 15:29:41 Failed to sync: not deleting files as there were IO errors

This happens on all three attempts. On every sync.
#### I have the following situation:

I wan to sync this folder from my Dropbox account down to my server. Which works, but whenever I change something in the Dropbox and run the sync again it will not delete files and folders. 
#### What the problem is:

I also have BitTorrent Sync running on this folder to share it with other people. But BTSync requires a '.sync' folder inside the folder it is supposed to share. I made this folder manually and set the permissions to btsync:btsync (the btsync user) to avoid it being deleted by tools like rclone and other file operations like rm. rclone now wants to delete this folder because it does not exist in the Dropbox, and because it can't, it fails and doesn't delete anything at all. Not even the files I deleted from my Dropbox, it will just leave them there for me to clean up manually, which isn't very convenient with 70000> files.

The same also happens when I delete the folder contents (minus the .sync folder) and let rclone redownload all the files. Is there any way to exclude the .sync folder (or any local folder it can't access) from rclone?  (--exclude .sync did not work)

I also tried it out a second time. I made a new folder, put a .sync folder inside and changed the owner to www-data:www-data. rclone failed in the same way.

issue.title: ACD remote files/folders do not get deleted when local files/folders are deleted

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I have a external drive with a bunch of files and a copy of my home directory. I was backing up to Amazon Cloud Drive and I noticed some non encrypted files got uploaded due to a few symlinks that got copied to the external drive with the copy of my home directory. I went through and removed all the symlinks that link outside of the backup directory and then ran rclone again. I expected rclone to remove files that no longer exist but it didn't. Seems like this is a bug, isn't sync supposed to remove files on the remote that no longer exist?

My system is Arch Linux 64 bit with rclone v1.33-DEV  and I was trying to upload to Amazon Cloud Drive.  

Command I used: sudo rclone --config /home/raansu/.rclone.conf -v sync /mnt/split/encrypted/ "amazon-cloud:My Drive"

Does this issue relate to issue #100 ?

body: Would this also allow to continue uploading if a directory can't be read? (Permission denied) #1385

I have a problem along the lines of those discussed on this page. I encountered the problem first on rclone 1.2. To try to fix it, I installed rclone 1.3.7. But the problem seems to persist.

The problem, more specifically, is this: I tell rclone to back up (sync) /etc/folderA. I do not tell it to backup /etc/folderB, which is a system folder with special permissions. (For, I use an --include-from flag and file, and that file does not include that folder.) Indeed, I tell rclone explicitly (via an --exclude-from flag and file) to ignore /etc/folderB. However, Rclone still reports as follows:

error reading source directory "/etc/folderB" [. . .] permission denied.

(Perhaps it is worth adding this: RcloneBrowser does not give me to understand that /etc/folderB exists already within the backup.)

Please advise!

EDIT: I discover that deleting my old backups and redoing them - with the new version of rclone - solves the problem.

Sorry - I spoke to soon. There was an error in my backup setup, such that it wasn't trying to sync anything. Now that it is trying to sync things, I get problems.

Here's my setup.

**rclone command**

```
rclone \
	sync \
	-q \
	--include-from "$LISTS"/etc_include \
	--bwlimit=3M \
	--ask-password=false \
	--tpslimit "$TPSLIMIT" \
	--tpslimit-burst "$TPSLIMIT_BURST" "$sourcePath" "$destinationPath"
```

**etc_include file**

```
# etc_include
# Backups using this should have /etc as their local root

# ================
# Individual files
# ================

/rc.local
/fstab

# ===============================
# Folders
# Format: /<folder>/**
==================================

/auto.master.d/**
/autofs/**
/cron.d/**
/cron.daily/**
/cron.hourly/**
/cron.monthly/**
/cron.weekly/**
/udev/rules.d/**

# EOF
```

**Output to screen**
```
2017/08/27 02:38:09 ERROR : Encrypted drive 'erclone:/etc/': not deleting files as there were IO errors
2017/08/27 02:38:09 ERROR : Attempt 1/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "ssl/private": failed to open directory "ssl/private": open /etc/ssl/private: permission denied
2017/08/27 02:38:13 ERROR : Encrypted drive 'erclone:/etc/': not deleting files as there were IO errors
2017/08/27 02:38:13 ERROR : Attempt 2/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "ssl/private": failed to open directory "ssl/private": open /etc/ssl/private: permission denied
2017/08/27 02:38:15 ERROR : Encrypted drive 'erclone:/etc/': not deleting files as there were IO errors
2017/08/27 02:38:15 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 0 errors and: error reading source directory "polkit-1/localauthority": failed to open directory "polkit-1/localauthority": open /etc/polkit-1/localauthority: permission denied
2017/08/27 02:38:15 Failed to sync: error reading source directory "polkit-1/localauthority": failed to open directory "polkit-1/localauthority": open /etc/polkit-1/localauthority: permission denied
```

issue.title: Possible to copy open files on Windows with VSS?

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,
it would be very handy, if the program could copy, sync open files on windows plattform? As far as know therefor the program has to use VSS. Actual this is not implemented.
Any change to implement?

Best wishes
poul

body: I want to take that issue. Can you give me more detailed description?

@TenGumis - great!

Here is a quick sketch

First in `fs/config.go` add a new flag `IgnoreErrors` in the `Config` struct.

In `fs/config/configflags/configflags.go` add a command line parameter for `--ignore-errors`

    --ignore-errors         delete even if there are I/O errors

In `fs/sync/sync.go` look for all the places that `fs.ErrorNotDeleting` and `fs.ErrorNotDeletingDirs` are returned.  These need masking with `fs.Config.IgnoreErrors` so the error isn't returned if `fs.Config.IgnoreErrors` is set.

In `fs/sync/sync_test.go` write a test... I would probably add an extra bit on the end of `TestSyncAfterRemovingAFileAndAddingAFileSubDirWithErrors` which sets the flag and checks the deletions happen.
